events.title: Birth of William Shakespeare
events.description: William Shakespeare, the renowned English playwright and poet, was born on this day (baptized April 26, 1564) in Stratford-upon-Avon.
events.significance: Shakespeare is widely regarded as one of the greatest writers in the English language and world literature, shaping theatre and literature globally.

events.title: Death of William Shakespeare
events.description: William Shakespeare died on April 23, 1616, on his 52nd birthday according to the Julian calendar.
events.significance: Marks the loss of a monumental literary figure whose works continue to influence drama and literature.

events.title: Founding of the Turkish National Assembly
events.description: The Grand National Assembly of Turkey held its first session on April 23, 1920, in Ankara, marking the foundation of modern Turkish governance during the Turkish War of Independence.
events.significance: This event was crucial in establishing the Republic of Turkey and transitioning from the Ottoman Empire to a modern nation-state.

events.title: Madrid Train Bombings
events.description: On April 23, 1960, a series of bombings occurred on Madrid's commuter train system, attributed to anti-government opposition during Spain's Francoist regime.
events.significance: The bombings highlighted political unrest and opposition in Spain under authoritarian rule.

events.title: UNESCO designates April 23 as World Book Day
events.description: UNESCO proclaimed April 23 as World Book and Copyright Day to promote reading, publishing, and the protection of intellectual property.
events.significance: Encourages global awareness of books, authors, and the importance of literacy.
